Yahtzee API¶

Yahtzee API Class: Game¶

Module containing the Game class.

class yahtzee_api.game.Game(num_players)¶

Bases: object

Represents the larger game structure for Yahtzee.

Manages tracking and advancing global turns as well as initiating end-of-game scoring calculations. Creating a game will create instances of the Player object according to the specified number of players passed to the constructor.

players¶

A list of Player object instances, one for each participant. The player_name attribute is set to “P{index_in_players_list}” which can be used to distinguish players.

Type

list

remaining_turns¶

Global turn tracker.

Type

int

current_player¶

The player who is currently rolling dice/scoring.

Type

Player

num_players¶

Number of players in the game.

Type

int

winner¶

Player who wins the game.

Type

Player

tie¶

True if game ends in a tie - in this case, winner attribute will remain none.

Type

boolean

next_player()¶

Advances to the next player and moves to the next global turn when the last player is detected.

Once the 13th turn is completed, this method will automatically calculate the final scores and return a list containing the winner(s) Player object(s).

print_status()¶

Prints out the current moment-in-time status of the game.

Yahtzee API Class: Player¶

Module containing the Player class.

class yahtzee_api.player.Player(player_name)¶

Bases: object

Stores information about each player’s current status including score, theoretical score, rolls remaining in their turn, and the status of their last roll.

This class tracks the data associated with each player, and additionally performs all scoring calculations including all possible scores based on the current configuration of the dice and their scorecard.

player_name¶

A string containing the name of the player.

Type

str

score¶

An integer value indicating the point total for the player (calculated at the end of the game).

Type

int

scorecard¶

A list of lists tracking each row of a Yahtzee scorecard with each row of the card following this structure: [score, [dice used to get score], number of rolls].

Scorecard indices are as follows:

[0]: 1’s

[1]: 2’s

[2]: 3’s

[3]: 4’s

[4]: 5’s

[5]: 6’s

[6]: Three of a Kind

[7]: Four of a Kind

[8]: Full House

[9]: Small Straight

[10]: Large Straight

[11]: Yahtzee

[12]: Chance

Type

list

theoretical_scorecard¶

A list of lists tracking each row of a Yahtzee scorecard, calculated after each roll, with each row of the card following this structure: [score, [indices in self.dice of dice used to get score], number of rolls]. Theoretical Scorecard indices are as follows:

[0]: 1’s

[1]: 2’s

[2]: 3’s

[3]: 4’s

[4]: 5’s

[5]: 6’s

[6]: Three of a Kind

[7]: Four of a Kind

[8]: Full House

[9]: Small Straight

[10]: Large Straight

[11]: Yahtzee

[12]: Chance

Type

list

dice¶

A list of the 5 dice in play - index is preserved throughout calculations.

Type

list

rolls_left¶

Integer tracking how many rolls the player has left on the current turn.

Type

int

calculate_final_score()¶

Sums the total points a player has scored and stores it in the Player.score attribute.

This function can only be called at the end of the game when all 13 scorecard values have been scored.

Raises

ValueError – If scorecard is not complete (implying the game is not over).

end_turn(score_type)¶

Resets turn-based parameters and fills in scorecard based on player choice.

Parameters

score_type (int) – Index of the scorecard entry that the player has chosen to score for this round.

Raises

ValueError – If score_type is not between 0 and 12.

print_player_info()¶

Prints player’s entire information.

print_scorecard()¶

Prints out the player’s scorecard line by line.

print_theoretical_scorecard()¶

Prints out the player’s theoretical scorecard line by line baesd on their last roll.

roll_dice(dice_to_roll)¶

Rolls dice specified by the dice_to_roll list, updates related class attributes, and calculates the theoretical scorecard values.

Parameters

dice_to_roll (list) – A list of length 5 containing boolean values where “True” indicates the die in that position should be rolled.

Raises

  • ValueError – If the number of rolls remaining is less than or equal to 0.

  • ValueError – If the length of dice_to_roll is not 5.

  • TypeError – If the dice_to_roll list does not contain only bool values.

  • ValueError – If the player attempts to roll fewer than 5 dice on the first roll of their turn.

  • TypeError – If dice_to_roll is not a list.
